alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 1:37AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from previous excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following counties, Cabarrus, Iredell, Mecklenburg and Rowan. * WHEN...Until 445 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 133 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms has ended. Flood waters are receding; however, minor flooding continues in the advisory area. The upper reaches of Coddle Creek are above bankfull, and will slowly recede early this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Huntersville, Kannapolis, Cornelius, Mooresville, Davidson, Landis, Enochville, Coddle Creek Reservoir, Ramsey Creek Park, Lake Norman, Doolie and Mount Ulla. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
